adjectives.description: pharisaical (comparative more pharisaical, superlative most pharisaical)

entries.meaning: Of or pertaining to the Pharisees. [from 16th c.]
(chiefly Christianity) Emphasizing the observance of ritual or practice over the meaning; self-righteous, hypocritical. [from 16th c.]
examples: Thus Aurobindo Ghose stated that the puritanical, pharisaical British conquered in the name of liberty and usurped under the cloak of altruism.
